interestingFact: Japan has more than 6,800 islands and vending machines for almost everything — from drinks to umbrellas.
Canada has the world’s longest coastline, stretching over 202,000 kilometers.
Brazil is home to around 60% of the Amazon Rainforest, often called the ‘lungs of the Earth’.
India has the world’s largest postal network, with over 150,000 post offices.
Australia is the only continent without an active volcano.
The Great Pyramid of Giza is the only surviving wonder of the ancient world.
The Eiffel Tower grows about 15 cm taller in summer due to heat expansion.
South Africa has three capital cities — Pretoria, Cape Town, and Bloemfontein — each serving a different purpose.
Iceland has no mosquitoes, no army, and runs almost entirely on renewable energy.
Italy has more UNESCO World Heritage Sites than any other country in the world.
